container.heading: Data Reporting by Freestanding Medical Facilities

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Commission" means the Maryland Health Care Commission.
"Freestanding medical facility" has the meaning stated in Health-General Article, §19-3A-01, Annotated Code of Maryland, and COMAR 10.07.08.
"Freestanding medical facility pilot project" means one freestanding medical facility pilot project under Health-General Article, §19-3A-07, Annotated Code of Maryland.
A freestanding medical facility shall submit accurate, timely, and complete data which the Commission considers to be necessary for planning and analysis purposes, as requested by the Commission.
The information requested by the Commission may include, but is not limited to, the following types of information:
Aggregate facility data as follows:
Service configuration;
Location;
Operational characteristics; and
Utilization; and
Patient-level data as follows:
Demographic characteristics;
Admission, discharge, and disposition data;
Diagnosis and treatment data; and
Payment source and charges.
The Commission shall provide notice of the form, format, and schedule for data reporting by freestanding medical facilities.
Failure to report the data required under this regulation may subject a freestanding medical facility to penalties under COMAR 10.25.12.
Extension.
A freestanding medical facility, by letter to the Executive Director of the Commission, may request an extension of its data submission date.
The Executive Director of the Commission, for good cause shown, may grant an extension of a data submission date.

section.heading: Freestanding Medical Facility Pilot Project.
section.text: The freestanding medical facility pilot project shall report data to the Commission as specified under Regulation .02 of this chapter.

para.text: Subject to §B of this regulation, summary studies, reports, or other compilations developed by the Commission from the data submitted in accordance with this chapter are public information.
Disclosure under §A of this regulation may not be made in such a way that the data furnished for a specific patient can be identified.
